Class Brutus

java.lang.Object
Brutus
public class Brutus
extends java.lang.Object
A command line tool to brute force a rotational cipher text, by using the chi-squared law and letter frequencies for English.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static double[] english
    A set array of the frequencies of each letter in English language.

    • english

  • Constructor Details

    • Brutus

      public Brutus()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Takes a single string argument and attempts to brute force this cipher-text as English.

      The method first checks the number of arguments and prompts the user with an example if the arguments are not acceptable.

      If there is only one argument then the function will iterate through all 26 rotations to find the rotation with the lowest chi-squared score.

      Caesar.roate() is then used to print the most likely rotation as calculated before.

      Parameters:
      args - Takes a single argument which is the cipher text.

    • count

      public static int[] count​(java.lang.String text)
      Returns an array with 26 elements, counting the number of occurrences of each letter in a given input string.

      A nested loop is used to iterate through each letter in the array. For each upper or lower-case occurrence of this letter, the counter is incremented.

      Parameters:
      text - The input string to be counted.
      Returns:
      An array of 26 length, counting the number of occurrences of each letter in the source text.

    • frequency

      public static double[] frequency​(java.lang.String text)
      Returns an array with 26 elements; counting the frequency of each letter in a given input string.

      This function will call count() with the input string to find the occurrences of each letter. It will then go through each letter and divide it by the length of the string to get the frequency.

      Parameters:
      text - The input string.
      Returns:
      An array of 26 length, counting the frequency of each letter in the source text.

    • chiSquared

      public static double chiSquared​(double[] freq, double[] ref)
      Returns the chi-squared score for two arrays; representing the frequencies of each letter in the alphabet.
      Parameters:
      freq - A frequency list of the letters in the source text.
      ref - A reference frequency list for the letters in your language.
      Returns:
      The chi-squared score of the two arrays.
